profile.name: Sivaprasath Manivannan
profile.title: Tech Lead | Scientific Computing | Automation
profile.summary: A technologist with 10 years of research and software development experience in the oil & gas industry. Worked with aerospace and oil & gas majors in technology development and deployment at scale. Currently leading the development of an enterprise-scale automation platform with both physics & AI/ML based data analysis. Ensuring product success by serving as a liaison between cross-functional teams: product, engineering and ML scientists.

education.field: Permeability logging in tight oil & gas wells. Supervised by Prof. Pierre Bérest.
education.description: Developed a continuous, flow-based permeability logging technique in collaboration with TOTAL. Designed test procedures and interpretation workflows, validated through laboratory tests.

education.field: Multiphysics and multiscale modeling of materials and structures

roles.description: Leading the development of new automation microservices and AI/ML technologies in a multi-faceted role.

highlights.text: Lead a cross-functional engineering team of backend developers & ML scientists
subPoints: Own the product roadmap for AI/ML & automation workflows. Work closely with VP of Engineering and product champions to define this roadmap.
Perform systems design, assist in code reviews and documentation.
Run monthly internal demos at the organization level on new features and improvements.

highlights.text: Work closely with clients to understand their data and pain points and solve those challenges together. Worked directly with senior leadership from 4/5 oil supermajors.
subPoints: Developed data structures and APIs to ingest well completion data to perform real-time, recurring nodal analysis.

Led the PoC for ingesting high frequency permanent acoustic log data to continuously monitor layer contributions. Performed systems design, conducted line of balance meetings with cross-functional teams and ensured that the PoC was deployed to the client in less than 6 months.
Presented new features, product roadmap and collected feedback from clients at the user group meetings and various consortium meetings.

highlights.text: Advancing the development of AI/ML based solutions with hands-on development.
subPoints: Architected a U-Net deep neural network (CNN + attention mechanism) for semantic segmentation of time series data. Achieved an F1 score of 0.92 in detecting well shut-ins, a 20-year-old problem in the industry. Deployed the model in production using lightweight ONNX runtime.
Developed a tools-based agentic AI system using LangChain to interact with microservices. This was demonstrated in ADIPEC 2024.
Mentored a Machine Learning intern to develop classification models for well shut-ins

roles.description: Developed the MVP for a cloud-native automation platform.

highlights.text: Repackaged parts of a desktop application into a microservice, exposed methods as REST APIs, and deployed as a Docker container.
Worked closely with clients and account managers in identifying business needs and developed automated workflows for reservoir monitoring.

roles.description: Developed and maintained desktop applications for reservoir engineering.

highlights.text: Integrated new semi-analytical models and optimization algorithms in C++.
Implemented new features for pressure transient analysis, rate transient analysis, and a numerical simulation software suite.
Reduced system-level vibrations for commercial aircraft engines to optimize performance and achieve certification.
Performed finite element analysis using commercial software and presented results to the engineering team.

internships.company: Laboratoire de Mécanique des Solides, CNRS

roles.description: Master's internship focusing on thermal modeling of underground storage caverns.

highlights.text: Developed a semi-analytical model to predict temperature evolution in underground storage caverns during tightness tests.
Created a MATLAB program for thermal analysis and visualization of results.

roles.description: Bachelor's internship focusing on speeding up numerical simulations.

highlights.text: Increased the speed of linear thermal finite element analysis simulations by five times using Model Order Reduction techniques.
